definition: lit. to glimpse just one spot (of the panther) (idiom)/fig. to get an inkling of the whole picture
plan/strategy/outline/summary/slightly/rather/to rob/to plunder/to summarize/to omit
variant of 略[lu:e4]
to appear/also written 現|现[xian4]
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
spot/colored patch/stripe/spotted/striped/variegated

sentences.english: Its features were partly visible in the 2005 British parliamentary elections.
sentences.chinese: 有些特征可在2005年英国的议会选举中略见一斑。

sentences.english: Just consider the raw increase in the number of journals.
sentences.chinese: 只要看看科研期刊数量的增长就可略见一斑了。
素食论的虚伪，从此可以略见一斑。

definition: to look at sth through a bamboo tube/to have a restricted view
lit. to see a leopard through a narrow tube (idiom); fig. to miss the big picture
to find out about/to discover
lit. one spot (on the leopard)/fig. one small item in a big scheme
lit. see one spot on a leopard (idiom); fig. a restricted view
the full picture (i.e. the whole situation)/panorama
to peep/to pry into
variant of 窺|窥[kui1]
slight knowledge of sth/to know very little about a subject/a smattering
it goes to show that/one can see
it can clearly be seen (that this is the case)/it is (thus) clear/clear/visible
to appear vividly on paper (idiom); to show forth vividly (in writing, painting etc)/to stand out markedly
lit. to see one spot on a leopard/fig. a restricted view
one tiny clue reveals the general trend (idiom); small beginnings show how things will develop
some cases picked out as example/to highlight
needless to say/it goes without saying
there is a reason for it/(of sth) not incidental
